definition: erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]

sentences.english: Blaine stopped to chat with a friend and Guiteau saw his chance.
sentences.chinese: 布萊恩停下來跟一位朋友聊天，吉特奧看到了機會。

sentences.english: Every time we sit together talking, Ququ is open to speak his mind.
sentences.chinese: 每次我們坐在一起聊天的時候，蛐蛐總是暢所欲言。

sentences.english: This article helps you to add a chat system to your environment.
sentences.chinese: 本文幫助您向您的環境添加了一個聊天系統。

sentences.english: You think I'm just withholding information because I like hanging out with you?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲我會知情不報只爲了和你聊天？

sentences.english: The ability to create his profile to chat with other users via internal mail.
sentences.chinese: 能夠創建了其專頁聊天，通過內部郵件的用戶。

sentences.english: I was chatting with someone and didn't go back to my apartment until midnight.
sentences.chinese: 我聊天去了，聊到半夜纔回房間睡覺。

sentences.english: We'll be back in a minute with part 2.
sentences.chinese: 我們等一下會繼續我們的聊天。

sentences.english: But some Internet users want more than just someone to chat with.
sentences.chinese: 但是有些互聯網絡使用者想要的並不只是聊天的對象。

sentences.english: Four gossips were chatting in a doorway.
sentences.chinese: 四個老婆子聚在一家大門口聊天。

sentences.english: Hovering over the Chat Frame and using the mouse wheel will allow players to scroll through chat text.
sentences.chinese: ◦鼠標懸停在聊天框可以用鼠標滾輪捲動聊天記錄了。

sentences.english: Hovering over the Chat Frame and using the mouse wheel will allow players to scroll through chat text.
sentences.chinese: ◦鼠標懸停在聊天框可以用鼠標滾輪捲動聊天記錄了。

sentences.english: Check with your parents before going into a chat room.
sentences.chinese: 進入聊天室之前，先經得家長的同意。

sentences.english: Colleen would urge her sister to join her in bed. As they sat up in bed side by side, holding hands, Colleen and her sister would “just talk.”
sentences.chinese: 當她們姐妹在牀上肩並肩手挽手地坐着她們都會聊天。

sentences.english: I just want to chat with one of my old friend.
sentences.chinese: 我就是想跟我的一個老朋友聊聊天。

sentences.english: Phone calls and texts are great for private, personal chats.
sentences.chinese: 電話，短信對於私密，個人間的聊天非常不錯。

definition: erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
to talk endlessly/talking of anything under the sun
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to talk endlessly on the phone
to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
(Internet slang) awkward conversation/to have a cringeworthy conversation
to talk or chat about ordinary daily life
